descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will introduce students to the history of modern Southeast Asia, from the middle of the nineteenth century to the end of the twentieth century, as it appears in well-known works of Western fiction. Students will read novels by Joseph Conrad, George Orwell, Graham Greene, and Christopher Koch, as well as works of literary criticism and historical contextualization. They will examine how images of Asia have been constructed in Western fiction and the ideological work those images have performed.
